verses.text: And when any will offer a meat offering unto the \sc Lord\sc*, his offering shall be \add of\add* fine flour; and he shall pour oil upon it, and put frankincense thereon:

and he shall bring it to Aaron’s sons the priests: and he shall take thereout his handful of the flour thereof, and of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar, \add to be\add* an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the \sc Lord\sc*:
and the remnant of the meat offering \add shall be\add* Aaron’s and his sons’: \add it is a thing\add* most holy of the offerings of the \sc Lord\sc* made by fire.
And if thou bring an oblation of a meat offering baken in the oven, \add it shall be\add* unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.
And if thy oblation \add be\add* a meat offering \add baken\add* in a pan, it shall be \add of\add* fine flour unleavened, mingled with oil.
Thou shalt part it in pieces, and pour oil thereon: it \add is\add* a meat offering.
And if thy oblation \add be\add* a meat offering \add baken\add* in the fryingpan, it shall be made \add of\add* fine flour with oil.
And thou shalt bring the meat offering that is made of these \add things\add* unto the \sc Lord\sc*: and when it is presented unto the priest, he shall bring it unto the altar.
And the priest shall take from the meat offering a memorial thereof, and shall burn \add it\add* upon the altar: \add it is\add* an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And that which is left of the meat offering \add shall be\add* Aaron’s and his sons’: \add it is\add* a thing most holy of the offerings of the \sc Lord\sc* made by fire.

No meat offering, which ye shall bring unto the \sc Lord\sc*, shall be made \add with\add* leaven: for ye shall burn no leaven, nor any honey, \add in\add* any offering of the \sc Lord\sc* made by fire.
\add As for\add* the oblation of the firstfruits, ye shall offer them unto the \sc Lord\sc*: but they shall not be burnt on the altar for a sweet savour.

And every oblation of thy meat offering shalt thou season with salt; neither shalt thou suffer the salt of the covenant of thy God to be lacking from thy meat offering: with all thine offerings thou shalt offer salt.

And if thou offer a meat offering of \add thy\add* firstfruits unto the \sc Lord\sc*, thou shalt offer for the meat offering of thy firstfruits green ears of corn dried by the fire, \add even\add* corn beaten out of full ears.
And thou shalt put oil upon it, and lay frankincense thereon: it \add is\add* a meat offering.

And the priest shall burn the memorial of it, \add part\add* of the beaten corn thereof, and \add part\add* of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof: \add it is\add* an offering made by fire unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
